metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30542 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in Tab Strip in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.77 allowedan attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30542` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.4472.101-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
